se.idsec.sigval.cert.chain.impl

Class StatusCheckingCertificateValidatorImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • se.idsec.sigval.cert.chain.impl.StatusCheckingCertificateValidatorImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    se.idsec.signservice.security.certificate.CertificateValidator

    public class StatusCheckingCertificateValidatorImpl
extends java.lang.Object
implements se.idsec.signservice.security.certificate.CertificateValidator
    This is an implementation of the Certificate validator interface CertificateValidator in the sign service commons library This implementation uses the CertificatePathValidator class to perform path validation. If you need to run path validation in an isolated thread as a runnable object, then use the CertificatePathValidator class directly instead of using this interface implementation.

        Constructor for the CertificateValidator implementations
        Parameters:
        crlCache - The CRLCache used to support CRL status checking
        certStore - Optional cert store (mey be null) providing intermediary certificates
        defaultTrustAnchors - Optional default trust anchors used to validate certificate paths

    • Method Detail

      • validate

        public PathValidationResult validate(java.security.cert.X509Certificate subjectCertificate,
                                     java.util.List<java.security.cert.X509Certificate> additionalCertificates,
                                     java.util.List<java.security.cert.X509CRL> crls)
                              throws java.security.cert.CertPathBuilderException,
                                     java.security.cert.CertPathValidatorException,
                                     java.security.GeneralSecurityException
        Validate a certificate using default trust anchors

        This implementation does not support CRL input. the CRL input MUST be null or an empty list

        Specified by:
        validate in interface se.idsec.signservice.security.certificate.CertificateValidator
        Parameters:
        subjectCertificate - The certificate to validate
        additionalCertificates - Supporting certificates used to construct a path to trusted certificates
        crls - Certificate revocation lists. This MUST be null or an empty list.
        Returns:
        Result of certificate path building PathValidationResult
        Throws:
        java.security.cert.CertPathBuilderException - if certificate path building fails
        ExtendedCertPathValidatorException - if certificate validation fails
        java.security.GeneralSecurityException - never thrown but required by interface
        java.security.cert.CertPathValidatorException
